oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dipping Vat Problems in the Feedlot
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Griffin, Dee
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: dipping
cattle
parasites
Coumaphos (CoRal)
Prolate (GX-118)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dipping on arrival at most feedyards is a common practice, used not only to safeguard cattle from the external parasites (lice, ticks, mites) but is economically mandated by the packers to control grubs and by the USDA-APHIS for scab control. The only two dips I think you should consider are Coumaphos (CoRal) or Prolate (GX-118).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1984; 153-154
